message_1: Consider the elliptic curve given by the equation y^2 = x^3 + 3x + 8 over the finite field F17. Let P = (5,1) be a point on the curve. Compute 10P, i.e., add the point P to itself ten times using elliptic curve addition.
message_2:
To compute 10P, we will first find 2P, then 4P, and finally 10P using the elliptic curve addition formulas. The formulas for point doubling (2P) are:

λ = (3x₁² + a) / 2y₁ (mod p)
x₃ = λ² - 2x₁ (mod p)
y₃ = λ(x₁ - x₃) - y₁ (mod p)

For adding two distinct points P and Q (P + Q):

λ = (y₂ - y₁) / (x₂ - x₁) (mod p)
x₃ = λ² - x₁ - x₂ (mod p)
y₃ = λ(x₁ - x₃) - y₁ (mod p)

Given the elliptic curve y² = x³ + 3x + 8 over F17 and point P = (5,1), we will compute 10P.

1. Compute 2P:

λ = (3(5)² + 3) / 2(1) (mod 17)
λ = (75 + 3) / 2 (mod 17)
λ = 78 / 2 (mod 17)
λ = 39 (mod 17)
λ = 5

x₃ = 5² - 2(5) (mod 17)
x₃ = 25 - 10 (mod 17)
x₃ = 15 (mod 17)
x₃ = 15

y₃ = 5(5 - 15) - 1 (mod 17)
y₃ = 5(-10) - 1 (mod 17)
y₃ = -50 - 1 (mod 17)
y₃ = -51 (mod 17)
y₃ = 16

So, 2P = (15, 16).

2. Compute 4P = 2(2P):

λ = (3(15)² + 3) / 2(16) (mod 17)
λ = (675 + 3) / 32 (mod 17)
λ = 678 / 32 (mod 17)
λ = 678 / 15 (mod 17)
λ = 2

x₃ = 2² - 2(15) (mod 17)
x₃ = 4 - 30 (mod 17)
x₃ = -26 (mod 17)
x₃ = 8

y₃ = 2(15 - 8) - 16 (mod 17)
y₃ = 2(7) - 16 (mod 17)
y₃ = 14 - 16 (mod 17)
y₃ = -2 (mod 17)
y₃ = 15

So, 4P = (8, 15).

3. Compute 10P = 4P + 2P + 2P:

First, compute 6P = 4P + 2P:

λ = (16 - 15) / (15 - 8) (mod 17)
λ = 1 / 7 (mod 17)
λ = 1 * 5 (mod 17) (since 5 is the multiplicative inverse of 7 in F17)
λ = 5

x₃ = 5² - 8 - 15 (mod 17)
x₃ = 25 - 23 (mod 17)
x₃ = 2 (mod 17)
x₃ = 2

y₃ = 5(8 - 2) - 15 (mod 17)
y₃ = 5(6) - 15 (mod 17)
y₃ = 30 - 15 (mod 17)
y₃ = 15 (mod 17)
y₃ = 15

So, 6P = (2, 15).

Now, compute 10P = 6P + 4P:

λ = (15 - 15) / (2 - 8) (mod 17)
λ = 0 / (-6) (mod 17)
λ = 0 (mod 17)
λ = 0

x₃ = 0² - 2 - 8 (mod 17)
x₃ = 0 - 10 (mod 17)
x₃ = -10 (mod 17)
x₃ = 7

y₃ = 0(2 - 7) - 15 (mod 17)
y₃ = 0 - 15 (mod 17)
y₃ = -15 (mod 17)
y₃ = 2

So, 10P = (7, 2).
